column1: back of a length and some shape into the corridor from outside off. Left alone.
good length and slanted wide outside off stump, left alone
short of a length on off stump, gets on his toes and looks to tickle it behind square. Cops it on the thigh
full inswinger at middle stump. Punched back at the bowler who parries it to this left
full outswinger outside off and he leans in to punch off the front foot. Extra cover lunges to his left and can't stop it cleanly
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
fires this length ball down leg side. Stirling exposes his stumps as he looks to sweep and doesn't get bat on it
length on middle stump, exposes the stumps and sweeps again. This time he gets it to fine leg
short of a length and straightening outside off. He's shuffled and is down for a sweep again, this time he cops it on the body
length outside off, defended into the covers
full and down leg side, swipes this to deep square's right but he can't beat his dive to the right at the fence
full on leg stump, nudged through square leg off the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and slanted across off stump. Slashes and gets a thick outside edge out to third man
good length and shaping away outside off. Skips into the off side, gets behind the line and dabs it straight to mid-on with a closed face
spanked away. This is short and in his swinging zone and he picks it up from just outside off, on his front foot as he gets this wide of mid-on
good length just outside off, punched back to the bowler on the up
good length on off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
back of a length and in at middle stump. Gets on the back foot and whips to deep square
full on middle stump, plants the front leg across and flicks to midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched on the up through cover but Dawlat dives to his right to stop
full ball on leg stump. Once again the stumps are exposed as he looks to sweep. He can't get bat on it and the umpire says leg byes as this sneaks through the keeper
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
struck on the back thigh but it's outside the line. Mujeeb gets this to straighten from around the wicket with a legbreak release. Porterfield defends inside the line
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
loud appeal as Stirling swings across the line and is beaten on the inside edge. He's looking to pull this short of a length ball outside off
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
offcutter, back of a length and just outside off. Allows it to come and steers this behind square on the off side
back of a length and some lift at an off stump line as he looks to defend. He's beaten on the outside edge and this climbs over the stump
good length on off stump, straightens outside off. He dabs it into the off side with soft hands
good length outside off, brings out the reverse sweep and gets an under-edge onto pad
back of a length outside off, tapped into the off side off the back foot
short and wide outside off, plenty of time to back away and open up his arms. Punches it through extra cover
short ball outside off, gets on the back foot and drags this pull shot out to deep midwicket off the top part of the bat
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length, swinging away late outside off. He looks to punch on the up and gets it into the leg side off the inside half
a crisp drive straight to cover point. Full outswinger is met nicely on the pitch with a flowing drive
offcutter, back of a length outside off. Defended on the front foot
back of a length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, shuffles and pokes it into the leg side with soft hands
back of a length on off stump, drops it pitchside with soft hands off the back foot to steal the single
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers off the back foot
full and down leg side. Can't get bat on the sweep
arm ball, draws him forward and raps him on the front pad as he looks to flick. But that was going down
length on off stump, defended to mid-off on the front foot
googly. Comes in from around the wicket, beats the outside edge as he looks to defend on the back foot
full toss on leg stump, premeditated reverse sweep means he's clutching at straws. It goes to point feebly
back of a length on the stumps, defended on the back foot

chips it to the midwicket boundary from outside off. The line is predictable because Dawlat has been disciplined outside off. Sitrling's been looking to shuffle across every ball. This time he goes right into the off side and clips this on the up

lbw shout as he shuffles across and looks to whip again. This time it's an inswinger headed for middle stump. Leg stump is visible as he's struck but there looks to be height on this. He's a long way down the pitch
short of a length outside off, slashes and misses
length on off stump, watchfully defended past the non-striker and a confident call to take the single from mid-off
short of a length and wide outside off, climbs into it on the front foot and slaps it on the up through cover
low full toss outside off. Shovels it with a closed face to try and get it past mid-on. Gets it off the toe-end of the bat
short and wide outside off, cuts and misses
length outside off, reaches out for a sweep and gets it past square leg aerially
inside edge as he looks to cut. He's not picking Mujeeb at all. This skids in from a length at off stump and he's completely cramped on the back foot
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length ball pushed in at middle stump. He's struck right in front of the stumps as he looks to defend on the front foot but that's turned down. Very close shout. Was it going down?
Shahzad thinks there's an edge but he's the only one. Length ball outside off beats the outside edge and the wicketkeeper is manic in his appeal
length on off stump, shuffles across for a flick and deflects it behind square off the pad
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
short of a length outside off, sliced to point on the up
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
tossed up outside off, steps out and nudges into the leg side off the front foot
length outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
arm ball pushed through flat at leg stump and he swings it to the midwicket fence with an unattractive, but effective hoick
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
full on middle stump, jumps into the off side and nudges this wide of mid-on
good length outside off, thick outside edge to third man as he looks to drive on the up
good length and wide outside off. Slashes away from the body and misses
length ball angled in at off stump. Hangs the bat inside the line after walking down at this and gets an outside edge. Third man cleans up to his left
good length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
good length and in at off stump. Watchfully blocked from the crease
full outside off, pushed back down the pitch off the front foot
short of a length at middle stump, sweeps to long leg
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's right
full and wide outside off. Drives to extra cover's right but can't beat his dive
good length on leg stump, tickled through midwicket off the front foot
legcutter at a length outside off. Mistimes the attempted drive through the covers
good length on off stump, punched on the up back at the bowler who manages to get a boot on it
good length on middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
good length outside off, defended into the covers on the front foot
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on on the up
back of a length outside off, steered to third man off the face
is that dropped? t's certainly a chance but this attempted reverse sweep thuds into Shahzad's knee as he looks to get up

soft. Loopy length ball on leg stump, dipping rapidly and he's not to the pitch as he looks for a vigourous flick through square leg. Gets it off the inside half and it lobs in front of midwicket who gets down and forward to snap it up
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper's left off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed through point off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
full on middle stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
good length and just outside off, left alone
good length outside off, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
full on off stump, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point with the turn
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper cover
length outside off, pushed to sweeper on the up
short ball wide outside off, reaches out and slaps from underneath to get it over midwicket. Damp outfield means this won't roll into the boundary
short outside off, pulls aerially again and gets it to deep square

has he dropped that? There's a sound as Balbirnie hangs his bat out for a cut to this short ball. It goes straight through to the keeper who gets in a poor position and can't complete a straightforward take
length outside off, punched to extra cover on the up
floated up wide outside off, steps out and is forced to stop with his front pad. Beaten in flight
tossed up on off stump, steps out and drives to long-off
length on off stump, stays in the crease and opens the face to chip this towards extra cover
length and on the stumps. Hurriedly plays a sweep that he ends up scooping in short fine's direction
short of a length outside off, cuts but can't get it past point

close appeal for lbw! It's turned down. Oh this looks a very good appeal from Afghanistan. It's a full ball on leg stump that spins away a touch as he looks to sweep. Struck right in front of the stumps. Might be lucky there...
slower short ball outside off, 100ks, Stirling forces off the back foot and the ball bursts through cover
back of a length and outside off, Balbirnie extends his arms and flashes straight to backward point
on a length and on a fifth-stump line, Balbirnie opens the face and runs the ball to backward point with soft hands
pitched up and outside off, eases forward and drives it crisply to the left of mid-off
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover
chipped in the air but it does not carry to short cover
uses his feet and pats a quicker one to cover
non-turning legbreak, fizzes on off stump, nearly 100ks, worked away to the midwicket region for one
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, pushed to the covers
tossed up slower and fuller outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
back of a length on middle stump, goes deep in the crease and flays the ball away to deep point
good length and holds its line outside off, takes the outside edge and rolls away to the left of slip

very full on middle and leg, Stirling drops down to one knee, rolls out his wrists, and sweeps it away to deep midwicket. Stirling jogs across for the single. He seems to be in some discomfort. Is he suffering from cramps?
full on off stump, driven back at the bowler
full on off stump, drags a sweep to deep square's left
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
full ball outside off, a googly. He looks to sweep and gets an under-edge onto his boot
googly again, sliding in at leg stump. Jams it into his toe this time off the under-edge as he shapes to punch off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover off the front foot

edged and gone! Slider wide outside off, Balbirnie stays leg side of this and is forced to reach out for a cut. It's a weak attempt too. He's pushing too far away from the body and the outside edge is eaten up by the keeper
sliding into the hips, whipped away through midwicket
back of a length and turning into the hips, quietly tucked away to square leg
slower through the air and drifts in on middle, worked away to midwicket off the front foot
really full on middle stump, Stirling presses forward and jabs the ball to cover
slides in with the arm and cramps the batsman for room, squeezed out to the leg side
Sharafuddin goes up for an lbw appeal. Stirling is a long way down the track, playing around his front pad and missing. He is so far down and not given
straighter one on middle stump, 85ks, played back to the bowler
looped up on off and drifts away, catches the outside edge and rolls to the cover region
dipping in at leg stump, Niall presses forward but does not meet the pitch. Prodded to midwicket
low full-toss on off stump, driven straight past the bowler to the left of long-off. Stanikzai puts in a lazy effort, he goes with one hand, and concedes a boundary
off-stump yorker, jammed out to the off side
straighter one, the batsman plays for turn and watches the ball beat the bat
quick slider from Rashid Khan, Niall O'Brein prods at it and inside-edges it onto the pad
Stirling steps down the track, the bowler drags his length back on middle, punched back
Stirling uses his feet again, but the ball dips sharply, and he has to settle with a thick inside edge onto the pad
flatter on off stump, Stirling loses his shape and his slog-sweep only goes as far as midwicket
Stirling finally connects well and clears the boundary. He is helped by a half-tracker just outside off. He rocks back and muscles it against the turn over midwicket
down the track and clipped against the turn to midwicket
tossed outside off, driven with the spin to sweeper cover
short and goes straight on outside off, leans into it and punches through the covers
on a length on off, presses forward and defends to cover
full and outside off, Niall stretches out and controls a sweep behind square leg. He picks the gap and finds a boundary
short and sliding into leg stump from round the wicket, defended back to the bowler
Niall collapses his back leg and drives inside out through the covers
straighter one of off, Stirling tips and runs to cover to bring up his 13th ODI fifty off 77 balls. Niall shakes hands with the opener. Subdued celebrations. Stirling knows he needs to press on
was that the googly? Breaks back in, takes the inside edge and wanders away to square leg
looped up on the pads, Nial opts to hang back and nudge to short midwicket
even fuller on leg stump, eased down to long-on for one
tosses this legbreak up outside off, driven down to long-on
dragged down on off stump, camps back and forces a single down to long-off
very full and outside off, driven firmly to sweeper cover off the front foot
shortish and angling in at the top of off stump, played back to Nabi off the back foot
Stirling skips down the track, meets the pitch of this full ball on middle stump and taps a single down to long-on
Such fast hands from Niall. This was pushed through outside the line of off, he takes it from there and reverse-sweeps it in the air over short third man
darted in on middle from round the stumps, dabbed to cover. Niall chances a quick single but is sent back by Stirling
pushed through on middle, collapses his back leg and drives inside out to cover
goes straight on outside off, Niall stays beside the line and flashes to the covers
good length and breaks back in, this wrong'un hits the thigh pad
another wrong'un from Rashid. Breaks back in from outside off, snatches the inside edge and wanders away to the leg side
full and sliding away outside off, he does not pick the googly and is beaten on the outside edge. Three straight wrong'uns from Rashid
back of a length and outside off, punched up to the covers
looks like another googly, he plays inside the line and slices off the outside half to cover
finishes the over with a straighter one, which is pushed back to Rashid
slower offbreak, Nabi finds grip and turn and goes past the outside edge
Niall falls over on the sweep as the ball slides down leg for a wide
tossed outside off, Niall charges down the track, fetches it from outside off and drags a six over the wide long-on boundary. He did not meet the pitch but did not hold back
fuller and on off stump, Niall continues to attack Nabi. He drops down to one knee and smites a slog-sweep over midwicket
tucked off the hips in the gap between square leg and midwicket
shorter offbreak, driven against the turn to short cover
hung up in the air, drops down outside off, Stirling presses forward and smothers it
fizzes through outside off, pushed to cover

reverse-swept from middle stump to backward point's right. There's a horrible mix-up between the wickets. The throw from Najib is to the bowler. Mujeeb gathers it and breaks the bails to catch Stirling short. The well-set batsman has been run out. Stirling knew he was gone. The TV umpire confirms it. The last thing Ireland wanted is a run out
skids on outside off, cracked through cover-point
tossed up and breaks back in to beat the inside edge and hit the pad outside the line of off
on a length and spins in, defended back
tossed just a shade outside off, dead batted
full on a fourth-stump line, bunted back
tossed wide outside off, stabbed back to the bowler off the inside half
full on middle, backs away and drives inside out to cover
slower through the air on off, not much turn, tip and run to point
shuffles across and whips the ball from outside off to midwicket
flighted outside off, spins in on off, shuffles across and plays it back to the bowler with soft hands
back of a length on off, punched back
fuller on off, guided off the face to backward point
swept from outside off to fine leg. The fielder in the deep runs to his right and boots the ball back into the field of play
now it's Simi's turn to fetch the ball from outside off and sweep with the wrists to long leg
turn and bounce outside off, drags the batsman forward and skips past the outside edge
back of a length and outside off, leans back and punches it solidly to the off-side sweeper for one
back of a length and angling across off, rides the bounce and dabs to backward point
back of a length and outside off, scythed away to deep backward point
tip and run to the covers, smart running from Niall and Simi

overpitched and wide outside off, Niall stretches out and drives to the left of Shenwari at short extra cover. Niall plays an aerial drive instead of keeping it down. Dawlat returns and takes down Niall. Both set batsmen are gone now
short and wide outside off, gets on top and slaps it to sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, Kevin stays beside the line and jabs the ball to the cover-point region
googly, full outside off. Driven firmly to long-off
full outside off, cops it on the pad as he looks to sweep
beaten on the outside edge as he gets on the back foot and looks to nudge this through the off side
short of a length outside off, gets well outside off and looks to tap it into the leg side. Cops it on the back pad
back of a length outside off, nudged in front of short third man off the back foot
googly, coming in at off stump at a good length. Looks to push it through the covers off the front foot and gets it into the leg side off the inside half
short of a length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket's right off the back foot
short of a length outside off, defended to point off the back foot
offcutter, back of a length and in at off stump. Leading edge into the off side as he looks to flick
short of a length just outside off, guided to third man with an open face
appeal for both lbw and caught behind are turned down. This inswinger dips in late as he shuffles and looks for the flick. It's going down leg and clips his back leg as it does so
top-edge as he gets in a woeful position for the hook. 141kp bouncer aimed at the helmet and he's caught fending under it
good length at off stump, pushes it into the leg side off the toe-end
full on off stump, shuffles and flicks through square leg
yorker on leg stump, jammed down to long-on
full outside off, plonks the front leg across a long way for the sweep. Cops it on the pad
full on off stump, hurriedly pushed to midwicket
googly, slides down leg side after pitching short on a middle stump line
full on middle stump, tapped past the non-striker off the front foot
good length just outside off, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
short outside off, backs away to cut to sweeper
length and pushed through at the stump, tapped back to the bowler
short of a length at leg stump, pushed through midwicket off the back foot
full and fast on leg stump, pushed to long-on off the front foot
dropped. Walks well outside off stump and follows this legbreak with his arms. Jabs at it and gets an edge that's grassed by Nabi at slip
full outside off, drilled off the toe-end to sweeper's right
googly, back of a length and strikes him just outside off as he looks to defend on the front foot. Safe on the lbw because he's outside the line
short and wide outside off, shuffles, reaches out and dabs it past slip, very very late
googly at off stump, shuffles outside and cops it on the pad again as he looks to defend. He's well outside the line once more

taken down leg side. Simi Singh's painful stay comes to an end as he shuffles outside off once more and is too far away from this googly as it spins down leg. He's forced to reach out and can only get a slight touch on this
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper off the back foot
full outside off, sliced to backward point with an open face
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short outside off, backs away and cuts uppishly to sweeper cover
full on the pads, locks himself with the front foot stride across but he manages to get bat on the sweep and paddle it past short fine
good length outside off, dabbed into the off side off the front foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts straight to backward point
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
googly coming in sharply a she looks to punch through the covers. He gets an inside edge onto boot
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
googly raps him on the pad outside off as he looks to defend on the front foot. He's outside the line
good length outside off, defends inside the line and gets an outside edge that dribbles wide of short third man
full outside off, opens the face and gets it wide of backward point off the front foot
length ball deflects to short fine off his glove as he gets down for the sweep
short of a length googly cramps him on the back foot and forces him to dig this into the pitch
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, drilled on the up, straight to extra cover who fumbles to his right
slider at middle stump, nudged through midwicket with soft hands
googly ripping in at off stump, under-edges into the pitch as he shapes for the punch off the back foot
googly at a length on leg stump. Swats with the angle and manages to drag this to the long leg boundary
full toss outside off, carted straight to long-on
googly at a length on off stump, sweeps to find deep square
short of a length outside off, tapped through cover off the back foot
offcutter, short of a length outside off. Gets behind the line and runs it to third man's left
full on middle stump, punched to long-on from the front foot
short ball at the chest and he's late on the hook. Gets it through square leg off the inside-half of the bat
short ball outside off, looks to pull, beaten
offcutter short and wide outside off. Gets on top of it and cuts, but can't beat point

holes out to fine leg. Short ball, swivels and looks to pull but he doesn't manage to get over it. Ends up slicing from under and fine leg only has to take a few steps in to complete this...but Dawlat has overstepped. This will be not out. And a free hit!
slower bouncer dug in too short and well wide outside off
legcutter dropped short at middle stump. Lifts it over midwicket with a pull
good length on middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, climbs up on him as he looks to sweep. He steers it to short fine
full toss on middle stump, flicked to long-on's right
googly raps him on the thigh guard as he goes on the back foot to try and play the leg glance
length and in at off stump. Closes the face too soon on the flick and gets a leading edge to short third man
what a hit from O'Brien. Shuffles and gets behind this offcutter that's dug in short. Watches it come on and pummels this over the square leg boundary
offcutter dug in short again. This time he allows it to come in to him and deftly glances very fine. Fine leg has a lot of work to do to his right and he can't stop this with a slide
short ball outside off, another well-timed hook. This time straight to deep square
good length outside off, backs away to try and go inside-out over extra. But he ends up slicing off the outside half towards sweeper
short slower ball outside off sneaks through from under his pull shot as he lines up
slower bouncer climbs awkwardly at his grille and he ends up fending this into the leg side with his eyes closed
bowled him! Wicket number 99 for Rashid Khan. Comprehensively tonks off stump with a slider. O'Brien exposes the stumps and swats across the line to try and clear the leg side. Completely misses it
beats the outside edge with a googly. Draws him forward for the defence outside off and outfoxes him
googly at a length outside off, sweeps to deep square's left
yorker outside off, looks to play the reverse sweep and is beaten
short of a length outside off, allows it to come on and runs it to short third man
slider, back of a length at off stump. Pushed through midwicket with soft hands
slower bouncer and he gets under it to slice high. It trickles through the circle after landing inside but they take only one

good catch. Slower ball dug in short again, wide outside off. Looks to slap it over extra, gets it off the thick outside edge. It hangs high and makes point pedal backwards. He loses his balance but manages to get his hands around this
another slower ball dug in short. Pulls and is beaten
top edge flies over the keeper as he miscues the pull. It's the same plan from Zadran. Offcutter dug in short and he's swinging towards midwicket when he gets the top edge

yorker on off stump, jammed out to long-on off the toe-end. They come back for the second and this one is sent upstairs. Zadran has received the throw and taken the bails off at the non-striker's end but the batsman has made his ground
bouncer at the body, swipes under it and gets it to fine leg on the bounce. He keeps them to one
effort ball first up. Banged in short and climbs steeply onto Shahzad. He rises with it and pats the ball down to the leg side
follows the short ball with a very full ball angling in towards off, Shahzad's bat comes down at an awkward angle as he squirts an inside edge through square leg for a double
back of a length and slanted down leg, ignored, leg-side wide
short and angling in at off stump, fended off to the leg side
sliding into the hips, tickled away behind square leg. Leg bye
floated very full and on a fourth-stump line, tapped back to the bowler
very full and wide outside off, no shot
Shahzad has a big swipe across the line. He only drags an inside edge through square leg
short and cramps the batsman for room. Shahzad is forced to fend it away
floated full on off, defended off the front foot
full and angling into the pads, hangs back and picks it away to long leg
full and outside off, forward defensive
back of a length on off, Naib gets behind the line and blocks back to the bowler
half-tracker outside off, flashed away, Stirling dives to his left from cover-point and parries the ball to point
slower ball, 106ks, on off, forced down to mid-on
McCarthy drops a return catch. It bursts out. Tough chance. Good length and outside off, fiercely drilled back to the left of the bowler. Such ones stick or they don't. This doesn't
leg-stump half-volley, picked up and duly put away over short fine leg inside the circle. Filthy ball
slower full ball outside off, Shahzad mows it across the line to the right of mid-on. Back-to-back boundaries to follow the drop
Shahzad backs away outside leg now, opens up the off side, and slices this slower ball over extra cover
back of a length and nipping away outside off, smoothly punched to cover
slower cutter on off, defended back to Murtagh
back of a length and angling down the leg side for a wide
good length on off, forward and blocked back to him
on a length on a fourth-stump line, solidly pushed to mid-off off the front foot
full and outside off, punched between midwicket and mid-on
Shahzad stays leg-side of this full ball outside off and hits it to the covers
leg-stump full-toss, glanced away fine of deep fine leg. Afghanistan ticking away....
back of a length on off, punched down to mid-on
full and nipping in, turns the batsman inside out, finds the leading edge that is dropped into the covers
Naib deploys a strong stride and drives this full ball from outside off to mid-off
leg-side the radar. Re-set the radar, Mr.McCarthy
back of a length and outside off, a jabbing punch to the covers ensues
good length and angling into a gentle little bunt to the right of mid-on
back of a length and angling in towards the top of off stump, blocked back down the pitch
floated full on off, pushed to mid-on. Shahzad is sent back, and he beats the direct hit from Andy Balbirnie
back of a length on off, turned to midwicket
full and angling in, presses forward and whisks it away through midwicket
presses forward and works a middle-stump ball to short midwicket
punched to short midwicket again
starts off with a leg-side wide
much better. Good length and outside off, left alone
tight line on off stump, prodded back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Shahzad slogs down the wrong line... and misses
short, hit-the-deck bustle, flat-batted back to the bowler as Shahzad does not have enough room to work with
swiped away between deep midwicket and wide long-on for a couple of runs
short on off, Shahzad hops, skips, and punches to mid-on hanging back for one
slower offcutter finishes on off, punched up to short midwicket off the back foot
back of a length and angling in at off, seam-up, whipped away to the right of short midwicket now
Shahzad backs away and scythes a middle-stump ball to cover-point
clipped off the pads to fine leg
Shahzad backs away yet again, this time he scythes it away between cover-point and backward point. Muscled away
Shahzad stays leg-side of a back of a length ball outside off and slashes straight to backward point
in-between length outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, left alone in the channel
hip-high short ball on middle, Naib joins the party. He sizes it up and swats a pull away behind square leg to beats deep fine leg to his left
good length and nibbling away in the corridor, ignored
Naib gets behind the line of this back of a length delivery outside off and calmly punches to cover
back of a length outside off, some tennis-ball bounce for Rankin, left alone again
Murtagh squares up Shahzad and finds the outside edge, loops wide of backward point. Rankin extends his hands and stops the ball to his right
full and angling into a whip to deep square leg
plays around his front pad and flicks an inswinger wide of midwicket
backs away and punches up to cover
Shahzad backs away again and crunches it from the stumps to cover-point
regal shot and Shahzad rightly holds his pose and shows off the great poise. This was pitched right up at off stump, he checks his drive and chips it over the bowler's head. Shot of the day
rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and glides it behind point to deep third man
edged and flies past diving slip. Beats deep third man too. Much fuller and moving away outside off, Shahzad gets away with a thick outside edge
off-stump yorker, angled down to deep third man
length ball on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
back of a length on off, 133ks, presses forward and drives to mid-off
Naib gets on top of a short one outside off and coolly pats it down
shorter offbreak, crashed to short cover off the back foot
back of a length and spins back in, cramps the batsman for room, defended back

shorter offbreak again, Shahzad finds the gap now. He cracks it between the covers and point. Porterfield chases hard and slides in ball in even as he tumbles beyond the boundary. Poor running, just two
chopped straight to cover now
darted short and wide outside off, lashed away to backward point
punched with the break to the left of short midwicket
full and Rankin explores the channel outside off, ignored
back of a length and outside off, aerial punch to the left of backward point
short and outside off, upper cut away to the right of deep third man
full and straight, hangs back and clips it to deep square leg's left
back of a length on off, Naib softens his grip and blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, Naib sensibly lets the ball slide off the face to sweeper cover
nudged with the spin to square leg
nudged straight to square leg again
tossed up outside off, Naib presses forward, meets the pitch of the ball, and caresses down to long-on
straighter one on off, the batsman plays for turn, and edges it to point
wide of the crease, angling into a back-foot punch to short midwicket
down the track and whipped straight to short midwicket
tossed up liberally on off stump, played back to the bowler
shorter and skids through outside off, forced to short midwicket off the back foot
pushed through on off stump, shuffles across off stump and prods it back to the bowler
turning in to hit the thigh pad with extra bounce
floated on a fourth-stump line, shuffles across and defends back to the bowler
punched to short midwicket to round out a maiden
short and cramps the batsman for room, stabbed back to the bowler
Mo Shahzad ventures down the track, does not meet the pitch, and mows it away to the right of wide long-on. Balbirnie unable to push the ball back into the field of play
shorter and outside off, carved to backward point of the back foot
This is bigger and better. Shahzad launches it over the roof. He runs down the track again and muscles it away over the straight boundary. Afghanistan cruising towards the World Cup
down the track again, this time forced straight to short midwicket
whipped away again, this time in the gap to the right of short midwicket
Shahzad brings up a fifty off 48 balls. Short and wide outside off, carved away in the air wide of backward point. He's powering Afghanistan into the World Cup
pushed through just a shade outside off, Shahzad stretches out and drags a sweep over square leg

Shahzad goes for one big hit too many and holes out to long-on. Skids on outside off, Simi Singh finds some extra bounce and forces the opener to fetch the slog-sweep from there. The batsman aimed to launch it over midwicket. He instead splices it straighter to Rankin. A little opening for Ireland?
good length on off stump, flicked to midwicket
full on middle stump, clipped off his toes, straight to midwicket
full on middle stump, pushed to midwicket with the turn
back of a length on middle stump, nudged to square leg off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
back of  length on middle stump, pushed to square leg off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length on leg stump, glanced straight to short fine
good length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
tossed up outside off and he leans in nicely to drive through extra cover
back of a length on leg stump, punched through long-on off the back foot
good length on leg stump, poked to midwicket from the crease
back of a length on leg stump, shovelled to midwicket off the back foot
length on leg sump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, pushed to long-on off the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off, pushed through cover off the front foot
length on middle stump, driven to long-on
length on middle stump, steps out to drive to long-on
length on middle stump, dragged on the up to long-on
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, punched back to the bowler on the up
good length and in at middle stump. Punched on the up to mid-on
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, a sweet on-drive that's half-stopped by mid-on diving to his left
length on leg stump, nudged wide of short midwicket on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
back of a length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket

short and wide outside off, backs away to cut and gets a thick outside edge that teases Boyd Rankin at short third man. The fast bowler gives chase but it's a half-blooded effort at the line and he can't flick it back in
back of a length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on off stump, defended off the inside half
good length and just outside off. Driven on the up to extra cover
length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover's left. He can't stop cleanly
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
shot. Bludgeoned down the ground. Steps out to meet this length ball at the pitch and pumps it past the non-striker
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length and in at middle stump. Flicke d to deep square
good length on middle stump, flicked to long-on off the front foot
length on middle stump, steps out and flicks. Can't get it past short midwicket
short of a length in the corridor, looks to whip this wide of mid-on with a short-arm jab but he's beaten on the inside edge
length outside off, leans in and steers this to third man
full on off stump, tapped to mid-on off the front foot
back of a length outside off, guided to third man off the outside half
good length on middle stump, clipped to deep square's left on the up
length on off stump, pushed to mid-off on the up
full on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, pushed to silly mid-on off the back foot
length ball outside off, can't beat extra cover with the drive
chipped to short midwicket! Shah steps out and doesn't get to the pitch of the ball. He clips on the up and as a result he can't keep this down. It's straight to the fielder who takes a low catch
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, stabs and is beaten
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
back of a length on off stump, leading edge intooutside edge evades first slip safely. He closes the face too early at this length ball in the corridor the off side as he plays on the back foot
inside edge as he prods away from the body. This one is in the corridor as well and his feet don't move as he follows with his hands
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length on leg stump, pushed to deep square from the crease
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
beaten on the outside edge as he follows this with the drift outside off
back of a length on off stump, tapped to extra cover
length on off stump, driven to extra cover's right
beaten on the outside edge as he gets back to play the cut to his ball outside off
back of a length on off stump, thick outside edge to third man
good length on leg stump, nudged in front of mid-on with soft hands
good length on off stump, tapped to mid-off on the up
short of a length outside off, defended down the pitch
outside edge lands short of Stirling at fourth slip. Length ball in the corridor and he looks to punch this through the off side

top edge taken at point! Gulbadin has fallen just on the verge of what might have been Rankin's last ball of this spell. It's a short ball in the corridor and he looks to pull without shifting his weight backwards. Ends up wafting from underneath and it's a simple catch
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the inside edge on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, whipped straight to midwicket
length outside off, driven off the outside half to short third man
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length and down leg side. Looks to flick and can't get bat on it
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
good length and in the corridor, defended off the back foot
full and some late swing away outside off. Looks to drive forcefully but gets it to mid-off off the toe-end
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
gets it past point. Good connection on this square drive as he reaches out wide outside off on the front foot. Point dives to his right but this has zoomed away
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
well executed reverse sweep. Clears short third man by a long way. This is a full ball wide outside off and he gets right under it before launching it over that fielder
full on off stump, driven back at the bowler
a conventional sweep this time. It's a length ball on the pads and he shows incredible bat speed for this sweep. Deep square stops to his right
good length on middle stump, flicked uppishly to deep square
short and wide outside off. Stabs and misses
short and wide outside off, slashes and misses
short of a length outside off, pushed straight to point off the back foot
good length on off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
appeal for caught-behind down the leg side but the umpire signals that it's pad. He was looking to flick this overpitched ball angled down leg
inside edge onto thigh guard as he looks to flick this length ball from outside off
length on off, defended on the front foot
length on middle, tickles it to short fine with a mistimed sweep
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length on off stump, looks to reverse sweep and cops it on the hand. Loud appeal for lbw is turned down
good length on off stump, pushed towards mid-off on the front foot
length outside off, throws his hands through the line and lifts this over mid-off. He hasn't timed it well, the bat turns in his hands. And the outfield holds the ball in place for the fielder
short of a length outside off, tapped into the covers
nearly chips it back to the bowler. Low full toss shapes away late and his feet are rooted as he looks to drive this. It comes off the toe-end and luckily for him, goes wide of the bowler
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on's right
wide of the crease, darted into the pads, picked off to deep midwicket
rolls out a sweep and sends it to deep square leg. Good urgency: they come back for the second
full, non-turner outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
wide of the crease, turns in on middle and leg, nurdled with the spin to square leg
tossed up and sticks in the pitch, chipped in the air to the bowler's right
darted into leg stump, clipped into the vacant spaces at square leg and that's drinks in Harare
nip-backer from wide of the crease, catches Shenwari in the crease, an inside edge saves the batsman
another sharp nip-backer from wide of the crease, pings the back thigh, but this looks like it has done too much
Shenwari searches for the ball and jabs away from the body. The result is another inside edge
full and holds its line outside off, stretches out and drives to mid-off for a hasty single
short and kicks up on off stump, Nabi goes deep in the crease and punches to short cover
full and angling in on middle, catches the inside edge and sneaks away to the leg side
tossed up just a shade outside off, he stretches across off and sweeps it up and over short fine leg
slower and outside off, jabbed back to Simi off the inside half

Simi Singh claims his third wicket and tightens the chase. This was fired in on middle, Simi pulled his length back after seeing Nabi foray down the track. He does not meet the pitch of the ball and winds up dragging a catch to deep midwicket
skids on outside off, reaches out for the ball with his hands and chops tantalisingly past the off stump
straighter one on off, catches the outside edge and lobs in front of point
tossed on middle, defensively nudged to midwicket
full on middle, forward and bunted to midwicket
forced to covers
good length and angling into a push past the bowler
fuller and outside off, squeezes a single to mid-off hanging back
not short enough for the cut although the width was there, beaten outside off
Stanikzai darts down the track, he is rushed into a slog, and wears it on the thigh. That might have been hitting the stumps but he was a long way down the pitch
slower offbreak on middle, tapped to the right of short midwicket
shuffles across and works with the turn to short midwicket's right again
full and dipping at off stump, turned away to the leg side
flatter and faster on middle, nudged to the right of short midwicket again
shuffles across and works to square leg
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, jabbed back to Simi
back of a length and outside off, slashes and sends a thick outside edge fine of deep third man. Stanikzai won't complain
full and nibbling in at off stump, he plays back and dabs to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, run away to the left of backward point and right of deep third man
slower cutter? finishes on middle, whisked to short midwicket
back of a length on off, Shenwari lets the ball slice off the face to backward point
overpitched and outside off, leans into it and cracks a drive to sweeper cover
full on middle, played back to Simi. How did this come down to a run a ball? especially after Shahzad's blitz upfront
nurdled with the turn to midwicket
the batsman feigns to step out, Simi drags his length back outside off, forced down to long-on
pushed through outside off, defended back. Afghanistan need more than a run a ball
full on middle stump, eases forward and drives a single down to long-on
straight ball on middle, gets inside the line and tickles it to square leg. Simi ends with a potentially match-winning 3 for 30?
shortish and outside off, Rankin hits the pitch harder, finds extra bounce. Chopped away to backward point
full indipper, sharp movement for Rankin, poked away through vacant slips off a leading edge
back of a length on off, cramps the batsman for room, whisked to short midwicket
gets on top of a shortish ball outside off and steers to backward point
floated full and outside off, tapped to extra cover off the front foot
full and straight, clipped down to long-on. Excellent over from Rankin: just two off it
back of a length and skids on off, can't get it past short midwicket
short and down leg, pulled only as far as long leg
flat and on leg stump, nurdled through square leg
full on the stumps, tapped to short midwicket
full-toss on the leg stump, swept away to the right of short fine leg. Balbirnie dives to his right and takes some pace off the ball
flatter and slides in on middle, played back to the bowler
hip-high short ball on off stump, possibly a slower one, offcutter it was. The batsman waits for it to arrive and swats it away between deep midwicket and wide long-on

length ball outside off, Stanikzai muscles it and just clears long-on. Balbirnie leaps back. No dice. He can only watch the ball sail over. Two boundaries to kick off the over. Afghanistan could not have asked for a better start to the over
much fuller and outside off, carved over extra cover. Stanikzai calls for two and gets it. He draws cheers from the Afghanistan change room
full and skidding in from wide of the crease, plays around his front pad and deflects it to the leg side
full and floated down the leg side for a wide. McCarthy has lost his line and his head

McCarthy finds redemption. A very tense finish brewing in Harare. A World Cup spot is on the line. This was overpitched and outside off, instead of scything it over the boundary Shenwari slices it to backward point. Good, low catch under pressure from Wilson
short and wide outside off, chopped away to sweeper cover. 15 off the over and a wicket
shorter and outside off, gets on top of the bounce and punches square through the off side
slower short ball outside off, one for the over says umpire Wilson. This was left alone
another slower short ball outside off, he waits for the ball to arrive and deftly runs it away fine of Rankin at short third man for four
back of a length and angling in at top of off, blocked back to the bowler
tickled off the pads to fine leg for a couple of runs
very full on the pads, nudged to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, extends his hands and carves it away to deep point for a single
Rankin finds extra bounce and attacks the body, Najib looks away and splices it to point
back of a length and hits the bat hard again as opposed to bat hitting ball. Defended to the off side
short on the hips, deflected behind square on the leg side. Stanikzai rushes back for the second and clutches his side
back of a length and slanting away outside off, punched crisply but Simi throws himself to his right from backward point to stop the ball
shorter and outside off, glided away to the right of Simi now
very full and attacking the stumps, Najib camps back and works the ball straight to short midwicket
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, whisked to short midwicket again. Down to a run a ball again
back of a length and angling across off stump, swiped away to the right of long leg. Rankin isn't the quickest in the outfield and Afghanistan take two runs
back of a length on off, cramps the batsman for room, clipped straight to short midwicket
full and angling away outside off, right in the swinging arc, Najib clears his front leg and tonks it hiiiiiiiiiiiiigh over midwicket. Launched into the stands. He narrows the gap with a mighty blow
chest-high short ball on middle, this is more a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull. The ball sneaks away to the leg side
back of a length and sliding onto the leg stump, picked away fine of long leg. Balbirnie slides in the deep and hauls the ball back into the field of play. Just two in the end
Najib backs away outside leg, this is darted short and wide outside off. Upper cut away over backward point
Has Stanikzai feathered it behind? There's a little noise and Niall is excited. Back of a length and outside off, he cuts away from the body and misses
on a length and outside off, dabbed away fine of third man. Stanikzai hobbles back for the second
short and rising into the body, the batsman rises with it, fends to point
short on middle stump, miscues a pull over midwicket. Scorers are level

Afghanistan qualify for the World Cup! Stanikzai punches his fist in the air repeatedly. Heartbreak for Ireland. Heartbreak for Zimbabwe. Off-stump yorker, Stanikzai jabs his bat down and sends a thick inside edge past the leg stump
